quoteFirst: Saviour; but in 1853, whilst the mortality in St. Saviour’s was at the rate of two hundred and
quoteLast: hundred thousand living, that of Christchurch was only at the rate of forty-three. Now St. Saviour’s is supplied with water entirely by the Southwark and Vauxhall Company, and Christchurch is chiefly supplied by the Lambeth Company.
title: On the mode of communication of cholera
author: Snow, John, 1813-1858

quoteFirst: His sentiments were regarded as hostile to slavery, and to be hostile to slavery was to fall inevitably under the ban in any part of the South for the fifty years preceding the war.  His political strength was with the non-slave-holding white population of Tennessee which was vastly larger than the slave-holding population, the proportion indeed being
quoteLast: .  With these a "good fellow" ranked all the higher for not possessing the graces or, as they would term them, the "airs" of society.
title:
